verses.kjv: Then again Abraham took a wife, and her name was Keturah.
verses.ct: Abraham married another wife, whose name was Keturah.

verses.kjv: And she bare him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.
verses.ct: She gave birth to Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.

verses.kjv: And Jokshan begat Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
verses.ct: Jokshan became the father of Sheba and Dedan. Dedan's descendants were the Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abidah, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
verses.ct: Midian's sons were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abidah, and Eldaah. All of these were Keturah's descendants.

verses.kjv: And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.
verses.ct: Abraham left everything he owned to Isaac.

verses.kjv: But unto the sons of the concubines, which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.
verses.ct: But while he was still alive, Abraham gave gifts to the sons of his secondary wives and sent them off to the eastern lands, away from his son Isaac.

verses.kjv: And these are the days of the years of Abraham’s life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years.
verses.ct: Abraham lived a total of 175 years.

verses.kjv: Then Abraham gave up the ghost, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
verses.ct: Then Abraham took his last breath and passed away at a ripe old age, having lived a long and full life, and he joined his ancestors.

verses.kjv: And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre;
verses.ct: His sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field that had belonged to Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, near Mamre.

verses.kjv: The field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth: there was Abraham buried, and Sarah his wife.
verses.ct: This was the field Abraham had bought from the sons of Heth. Abraham was buried there alongside his wife Sarah.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed his son Isaac; and Isaac dwelt by the well Lahairoi.
verses.ct: After Abraham died, God blessed his son Isaac. Isaac was living near the well of Lahairoi.

verses.kjv: Now these are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s handmaid, bare unto Abraham:
verses.ct: Here is the family record of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian — Sarah's servant — had given to Abraham:

verses.kjv: And these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebajoth; and Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
verses.ct: These are the names of Ishmael's sons, listed in order of birth: Nebajoth was the firstborn, followed by Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

verses.kjv: And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,
verses.ct: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,

verses.kjv: Hadar, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah:
verses.ct: Hadar, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their castles; twelve princes according to their nations.
verses.ct: These were Ishmael's sons, and these were their names according to their settlements and encampments — 12 tribal leaders over their respective peoples.

verses.kjv: And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, an hundred and thirty and seven years: and he gave up the ghost and died; and was gathered unto his people.
verses.ct: Ishmael lived 137 years. Then he took his last breath and passed away, and he joined his ancestors.

verses.kjv: And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur, that is before Egypt, as thou goest toward Assyria: and he died in the presence of all his brethren.
verses.ct: His descendants settled in the region stretching from Havilah to Shur, which is east of Egypt on the way to Assyria. They settled near all of their relatives.

verses.kjv: And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham’s son: Abraham begat Isaac:
verses.ct: This is the family record of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham became the father of Isaac.

verses.kjv: And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padanaram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.
verses.ct: Isaac was 40 years old when he married Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean from Padanaram and the sister of Laban the Aramean.

verses.kjv: And Isaac intreated the LORD for his wife, because she was barren: and the LORD was intreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
verses.ct: Isaac prayed to the LORD on behalf of his wife because she couldn't have children. The LORD answered his prayer, and his wife Rebekah became pregnant.

verses.kjv: And the children struggled together within her; and she said, If it be so, why am I thus? And she went to enquire of the LORD.
verses.ct: The babies were pushing and shoving inside her, and she said, "Why is this happening to me?" So she went to ask the LORD about it.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto her, Two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.
verses.ct: The LORD told her, "Two nations are inside you, and two peoples will go their separate ways from birth. One will be stronger than the other, and the older will serve the younger."

verses.kjv: And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
verses.ct: When the time came for her to give birth, sure enough, there were twins inside her.

verses.kjv: And the first came out red, all over like an hairy garment; and they called his name Esau.
verses.ct: The first one came out reddish and covered all over with hair, like a fur coat. So they named him Esau.

verses.kjv: And after that came his brother out, and his hand took hold on Esau’s heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac was threescore years old when she bare them.
verses.ct: Right after that, his brother came out gripping Esau's heel with his hand, so they named him Jacob. Isaac was 60 years old when they were born.

verses.kjv: And the boys grew: and Esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a plain man, dwelling in tents.
verses.ct: As the boys grew up, Esau became a skilled hunter who loved the outdoors, while Jacob was a quiet man who preferred staying close to home.

verses.kjv: And Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of his venison: but Rebekah loved Jacob.
verses.ct: Isaac favored Esau because he enjoyed eating the wild game Esau brought home, but Rebekah favored Jacob.

verses.kjv: And Jacob sod pottage: and Esau came from the field, and he was faint:
verses.ct: One day Jacob was cooking stew when Esau came in from the open country, exhausted and starving.

verses.kjv: And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red pottage; for I am faint: therefore was his name called Edom.
verses.ct: Esau said to Jacob, "Please, let me have some of that red stuff — I'm completely worn out!" (This is why he was also called Edom.)

verses.kjv: And Jacob said, Sell me this day thy birthright.
verses.ct: Jacob replied, "First, sell me your birthright."

verses.kjv: And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birthright do to me?
verses.ct: Esau said, "Look, I'm about to die of hunger. What good is a birthright to me?"

verses.kjv: And Jacob said, Swear to me this day; and he sware unto him: and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.
verses.ct: Jacob said, "Swear it to me right now." So Esau swore an oath and sold his birthright to Jacob.

verses.kjv: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentiles; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way: thus Esau despised his birthright.
verses.ct: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and lentil stew. Esau ate, drank, got up, and left. That's how little Esau valued his birthright.
